results.title: Idebenone ameliorates statin-induced myotoxicity in atherosclerotic ApoE-/- mice by reducing oxidative stress and improving mitochondrial function.
results.journal: Biochim Biophys Acta Mol Basis Dis
results.text_hl: After administering @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ to @GENE_APOE @GENE_348 @@@ApoE@@@-/- @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, we observed a reduction in @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@plaque formation@@@ as well as a decrease in their exercise capacity.

citations.NLM: Yu W, Wu W, Zhao D, Zhang R, Shao K, Liu H, Yan C, Lin P. Idebenone ameliorates statin-induced myotoxicity in atherosclerotic ApoE-/- mice by reducing oxidative stress and improving mitochondrial function. Biochim Biophys Acta Mol Basis Dis. 2024 Apr 4;1870(5):167157. PMID: 38582266

results.title: Simvastatin exerts favourable effects on neointimal formation in a mouse model of vein graft.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ exerts favourable effects on @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointimal formation@@@ in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model of @DISEASE_Stenosis_Pulmonary_Vein @DISEASE_MESH:D000071078 @@@vein@@@ graft.

citations.NLM: Zhang L, Lu H, Huang J, Guan Y, Sun H. Simvastatin exerts favourable effects on neointimal formation in a mouse model of vein graft. Eur J Vasc Endovasc Surg. 2011 Sep;42(3):393-9. PMID: 21693384

results.title: Simvastatin inhibits human saphenous vein neointima formation via inhibition of smooth muscle cell proliferation and migration.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ inhibits @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ saphenous vein @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointima@@@ formation via inhibition of smooth muscle cell proliferation and migration.

results.title: Liposomal simvastatin attenuates neointimal hyperplasia in rats.
results.text_hl: The present study evaluated whether systemic and transient depletion of monocytes could be obtained by a single intravenous (IV) injection of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ liposomes, for the inhibition of @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointima@@@ formation.

citations.NLM: Afergan E, Ben David M, Epstein H, Koroukhov N, Gilhar D, Rohekar K, Danenberg HD, Golomb G. Liposomal simvastatin attenuates neointimal hyperplasia in rats. AAPS J. 2010 Jun;12(2):181-7. PMID: 20143196

results.title: Efficacy of simvastatin in reducing postoperative adhesions after thyroidectomy: an experimental study.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: We aimed to investigate whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ had any impact on the prevention of @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@adhesion formation@@@ after thyroidectomy in a @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model.

citations.NLM: Makay O, Isik D, Erol V, Yenisey C, Kose T, Icoz G, Ertan Y, Ozutemiz O, Akyildiz M. Efficacy of simvastatin in reducing postoperative adhesions after thyroidectomy: an experimental study. Acta Chir Belg. 2017 Apr;117(2):77-83. PMID: 27735220

results.title: Influence of simvastatin on microthrombosis in the brain after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats: a preliminary study.
results.text_hl: The purpose of this study was to determine the impact of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@microthrombi formation@@@ after @DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@SAH@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin rescues rats from fatal pulmonary hypertension by inducing apoptosis of neointimal smooth muscle cells.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ reverses pulmonary arterial @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointimal formation@@@ and @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@PAH@@@ after @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxic@@@ injury.

citations.NLM: Nishimura T, Vaszar LT, Faul JL, Zhao G, Berry GJ, Shi L, Qiu D, Benson G, Pearl RG, Kao PN. Simvastatin rescues rats from fatal pulmonary hypertension by inducing apoptosis of neointimal smooth muscle cells. Circulation. 2003 Sep 30;108(13):1640-5. PMID: 12963647

results.title: Statins for the prevention of vein graft stenosis: a role for inhibition of matrix metalloproteinase-9.
results.text_hl: Thus @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment appears to inhibit @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointima@@@ formation as a result of combined inhibition of SMC proliferation and invasion.

citations.NLM: Porter KE, Turner NA. Statins for the prevention of vein graft stenosis: a role for inhibition of matrix metalloproteinase-9. Biochem Soc Trans. 2002 Apr;30(2):120-6. PMID: 12023838

results.title: HMG CoA reductase inhibitors. In vivo effects on carotid intimal thickening in normocholesterolemic rabbits.
results.text_hl: Animals treated with @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ (n = 12), @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (n = 12), and @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@fluvastatin@@@ (n = 12) showed significantly less @<m>DISEASE_Neointima</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointimal formation@@@; I/M tissue ratios were 0.24 +/- 0.03, 0.20 +/- 0.03, and 0.17 +/- 0.03, respectively.

citations.NLM: Soma MR, Donetti E, Parolini C, Mazzini G, Ferrari C, Fumagalli R, Paoletti R. HMG CoA reductase inhibitors. In vivo effects on carotid intimal thickening in normocholesterolemic rabbits. Arterioscler Thromb. 1993 Apr;13(4):571-8. PMID: 8466892
citations.BibTeX: @article{8466892, title={HMG CoA reductase inhibitors. In vivo effects on carotid intimal thickening in normocholesterolemic rabbits.}, author={Soma MR and Donetti E and Parolini C and Mazzini G and Ferrari C and Fumagalli R and Paoletti R}, journal={Arterioscler Thromb}, volume={13}, number={4}, pages={571-8}}
